blog.name: calliopenotreal443
blog.title: Calliope Simmons.
blog.description: Hello, my name is Calliope, I am an ancient being shaped of a wolf, a God of light and life. Right in front of you, right in front of me. We were looking for somehow, some way we couldn't see. That the love was always there, It's been around us everywhere. I had to fall to finally see, that you were right infront of me.

tags: to all the boys i've loved before
im so proud of her and this book series
summary: No offense, but if #ToAllTheBoysIveLovedBefore had a white cast/white author with only half the acclaim it ended up with, the...
body:
No offense, but if #ToAllTheBoysIveLovedBefore had a white cast/white author with only half the acclaim it ended up with, the sequel (and third book) would have had a movie deal by the second day it was out. Netflix’s reluctance to make the second book  is undoubtedly directly related to the fact that Jenny Han and Lara Jean are not the traditional white female lead. Netflix just gave Chilling Adventures of Sabrina (an obviously subpar production and story with the same kind of fan following and content existence) a third and fourth season after the holiday special. (The second season was guaranteed around the premier of the first) Netflix has consistently been moving away from the diverse content creators, casts, and stories that made it popular in the first place Think of Sense8, Orange is the New Black, Hemlock Grove [stories and legends of Romani origin, rather than traditional western folklore] and the Get Down. All of these shows had spectacular fan followings by people paying netflix to watch these shows, stories, and casts.

Understandably, the first Marvel shows to be cancelled were the last released, but it’s odd that it was the shows with an Asian and a primarily (close to all) black cast. Consistently in recent months (about a year now) Netflix has released many many many original productions that feature white and straight leads primarily, with queer characters or characters of color regulated to the same tired tropes and positions that they are in traditional media. Even their cartoons (excepting the new She-Ra so far) have followed this pattern much to the chagrin of many fans who have been loyal to a brand they thought had been giving them the diverse content from Netflix of yore.

Let’s talk about the Friends thing. How can Netflix suggest that they don’t have the budget to continue making many fan favorite (diverse) shows, but then spend 100 Million dollars to keep Friends around? No one is subscribing to netflix to watch friends, but I did literally make a netflix account so I could watch Sense8. It’s not fair, it’s not slick. And it’s a betrayal to the the wonderful content creators and actors of diverse backgrounds that made Netflix so popular in the first place.

And maybe there’s more to the delayed sequel confirmation that we don’t know or understand, but any company that can drop 100 Million dollars on a TV show that literally airs on many cable networks in reruns most nights can afford to work out kinks to the sequel of one of their most popular releases of the year.

All of this to say that #ToAllTheBoysIveLovedBefore should already be guaranteed the sequel and third adaptation that any production with a white cast would have already been given.

summary: Disney+ Executive Provides Glimpse of Hope for Marvel's Netflix Shows Including Daredevil!
title: Disney+ Executive Provides Glimpse of Hope for Marvel's Netflix Shows Including Daredevil!
body:
Disney+ Executive Provides Glimpse of Hope for Marvel’s Netflix Shows Including Daredevil!

Kevin Mayer, who is the chairman of Disney’s direct-to-consumer and international offers, gave fans of Marvel’s Netflix shows including Daredevil, Luke Cage, and Iron Fist a ray of hope after Netflix cancelled them.

While speaking with The Hollywood Reporter, Mayer revealed they could be scooped up and brought into Disney+, Disney’s upcoming streaming service which will feature multiple…

View On WordPress

blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. title: Christmas Actually
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PSjEvE

by tropicalcap

The one where there’s a company-wide Secret Santa going on at Stark Industries and Natasha makes sure Steve gets paired up accordingly.

Or the “My best friend rigged the Secret Santa” fic.

summary: RT @Marvel: #MarvelsRunaways' @theryansands (Geoffrey Wilder) and @jamesyaegashi (Robert Minoru) are stopping by to answer YOUR...
title: RT @Marvel: #MarvelsRunaways' @theryansands (Geoffrey Wilder) and @jamesyaegashi (Robert Minoru) are stopping by to answer YOUR questions! Send us your burning (and funny) @marvelsrunaways questions with the hashtag #AskMarvel and stay tuned to see if they get answered in a future episode.

summary: I sent a text at the same time I was watching tv and I told her that I "knocked on wheel" because the show had a flat tire. So...
body:
I sent a text at the same time I was watching tv and I told her that I “knocked on wheel” because the show had a flat tire. So now I can never talk to MJ again.

- Peter Parker
